Q7-1.name: Q7-1
Q7-1.question: Rerun the code for an offshore wave height of 0.5 m (still with a period of 7 s and an incident angle of 5 degrees). What is the new predicted wave height at breaking (in meters)? Round your answer to 2 decimals.

Q7-2.name: Q7-2
Q7-2.question: And for this same wave height of 0.5 m, what is the value for the transport S [m3/s]? Either compute your answer, or read it from the plot. Round your answer to 4 decimals.

Q7-3.name: Q7-3
Q7-3.question: Change the offshore wave height back to 2 m. For what angle of incidence phi (in degrees) is the transport maximum? Round your answer to the nearest integer.

Q7-4.name: Q7-4
Q7-4.question: For which circumstances would the alongshore transport increase?

options.e: Angle of incidence increases from 20 to 80 degrees

Q7-5.name: Q7-5
Q7-5.question: After how many years does the accretion first surpass the breakwater length?

Q7-6.name: Q7-6
Q7-6.question: The angle of the coastline just beside the breakwater seems constant throughout the years, especially as we move to the later years. Using the (S,phi)-curve, determine this angle. Round your answer to the nearest integer.

Q7-7.name: Q7-7
Q7-7.question: Determine the expected yearly transport for a zero degree angle. Hint: we have seen this value before! Round your answer to the nearest integer.

Q7-8.name: Q7-8
Q7-8.question: Imagine we increase the depth of closure (DOC) from 7 m to 12 m. What would change with respect to the evolution of the coastal morphology? Hint: If you are stuck you can change the value of the DOC in the code. You will have to rerun the model in its entirety though.

options.a: The shoreline angle close to the breakwater will increase.
options.b: The accretion will extend further updrift.
options.c: The accretion will reach the tip of the breakwater faster.
options.d: The accretion profile will look similar but will develop slower.

Q7-9.name: Q7-9
Q7-9.question: Say we want to include shadow effects in our numerical model. Select the appropriate strategies from the options below.

options.a: reduce wave height for part of the grid depending on the angle of incidence
options.b: increase depth of closure close to the breakwater
options.c: manually decrease transport values close to the breakwater irrespective of the angle of incidence
options.d: reduce wave height for the entire grid

Q7-10.name: Q7-10
Q7-10.question: Say we want to include bypass effects in our numerical model, e.g. when the accretion reaches the tip of the breakwater. Select the appropriate strategies from the options below.

options.a: use a conditional boundary conditions which changes after accretion at the breakwater has reached a certain length
options.b: use a nonzero transport at the breakwater, depending on its assumed permeability
options.c: implicitly include bypass effects by including shadow zone effects
options.d: calculate the transport twice (with and without breakwater), and use some form of averaging to compute transport
